communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R010042-071325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
  
    Kittitas County Public Defense 
The Kittitas County Department of Public Defense received a public records request from you on July 13, 2025. You requested: "To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: - Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. - Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Moe Clark” 
The Department of Public Defense is a county agency that provides legal representation to indigent clients charged with criminal offenses. Except for any “lists, spreadsheets, or other organized datasets” referenced in your request, the records you are seeking originate from the Kittitas County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office and are provided to our office as part of discovery in cases where we represent defendants. Our office does not create or maintain “lists, spreadsheets, or other organized datasets” containing the requested information. 
Discovery is governed by CrR 4.7(h)(3) and (7), which prohibit defense counsel from disseminating discovery materials and authorize sanctions for violations of these rules. In addition, the Rules of Professional Conduct, specifically RPC 1.6, strictly prohibit attorneys from disclosing any information related to the representation of a client, regardless of its source. The information you are requesting is provided to us solely for purposes of client representation and pertains to the underlying case. Disclosure of such information would therefore violate RPC 1.6. 
The records you are seeking are available through the Kittitas County Prosecuting Attorney’s Office. To address your request as efficiently as possible, we have coordinated with that office. Your current request with our office will be closed, and a new request will be initiated with the Prosecutor’s Office. No action is required on your part at this time—you will receive further communication directly from the Prosecutor’s Office. 
The Public Records Act provides for a one-year statute of limitations. RCW 42.56.550(6).  This is the time allowed by statute for you seek judicial review.  The one year starts from the date of this communication. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me within 30 days by replying to this email or calling our office at 509-962-7042. 
Sincerely, 

Tasha Potter 
Public Records Officer 
Department of Public Defense

Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
Hi Kelly,

We received your Public Records Act request email for the following records on 8/27/2025:

“Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.”

We have conducted a reasonable search for these records under California Government Code §7922.535 and have determined that your request either in whole or in part, seeks copies of disclosable public records. We retrieved twenty-six pages responsive to your request. As the records previously existed in digital format, there is no charge. Please see attached. Note, the link in your email for uploading did not work.

Sincerely,


Mike



Mike Thorpe

Director | Enterprise Risk Management & Audit

Campus Records Officer

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 9, 2015. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response. This communication was originally to foiamail@atf.gov. Please see the following request. 
---
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:

An itemized list of products and services provided to the ATF by Harris Corporation under the 2014 contract Procurement ID: DJA13AHDQG0793.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Green

Dear Mr. Green, I hope this message finds you well. Thank you for submitting your FOIA request, reference number 2025-00512 . Please find attached the formal acknowledgement letter associated with your request. If you have any questions or require further assistance, kindly use the ATF FOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contact our office. You can access the portal by creating an account at https://foia-pal.atf.gov.  We appreciate your cooperation and look forward to assisting you. 

Sincerely, 

ATF FOIA Team 
Note: This is not a monitored mailbox and replies to this email will not be seen or responded to. If you have any questions or concerns, please use the ATF FOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contact our office. You can access the portal by creating an account at https://foia-pal.atf.gov. Additionally, you can contact the FOIAPublic Liaisons at 202-648-7390 for any further assistance and to discussany aspect of your request. For technical issue with PAL, please email foia-pal-support@atf.gov. Thank you for your understanding.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 1984 Democratic National Convention
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigative and/or protective duties conducted in regards to the 1984 Democratic National Convention, which took place at the Moscone Center in San Francisco, California from July 16th-19th, 1984. This is to include file 100B-SF-80307, captioned as DEMNAT and Major Case 53.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1659318-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000
Case Type:
FOIPA
Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.


Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into small (51-250 pages), medium (251-500 pages), large (501-4,999), and extra-large (over 5,000 pages) sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing. Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.
Currently, simple track cases average approximately 230 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 1,085 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,310 days, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 2,370 days  .


Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Fw: FBI Direct Referral FOIA# 1659318 / Democratic National Convention - [UNCLASSIFIED]
communications.communication:
UNCLASSIFIED
Greetings,

You have reached the Headquarters Department of Army Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Referral Center. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional customer service to reach the highest level of customer satisfaction.
Our office is not the records owner of the documents that you are seeking. Requests for information and documents under the purview of the Army are referred to the proponent agency for appropriate handling in accordance with Army Regulation 25-55, The Army Freedom of Information Act program. Your FOIA request has been assigned a case tracking number: FA-25-8304 / FP-25-033285.
The correct office to process your request is U.S. Army Deputy Chief of Staff G-3/5/7.  We have copied their FOIA office and referred your request to them by way of this email for processing and direct response to you.
Note: Once the appropriate office receives your request, a new FOIA case tracking number will be assigned, and their contact information is listed below:

Deputy Chief of Staff G-3/5/7

ATTN: DAMO-ZCA
400 Army Pentagon
Washington, DC  ZIP:  20310- 0400
Phone: (571) 256-7607

Thank you for your submission.
DA FOIA

UNCLASSIFIED

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Massachusetts Department of Correction (Central Office))

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Massachusetts Department of Correction (Central Office))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: Public Records :: R000703-051525
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Ma: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Massachusetts Department of Correction. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 5/15/2025 and given the reference number R000703-051525 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question.

title: Rifle inventory records (Orange County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Rifle inventory records (Orange County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records of the most recent inventory of rifles possessed by the Sheriff's Office, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code (assault rifles, patrol rifles, sniper rifles, .50 caliber rifles).
2. Records indicating the number of rifles, as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code,  privately possessed by personnel of the Sheriff's Office with its authorization, OR the number of Sheriff's Office personnel with such authorization.

To assist with the prompt release of responsive material, I ask that you make records available to me as you locate them, rather than waiting until all responsive records have been collected and copied.
 
The requested documents or information from them will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you would like to discuss these requests, please feel free to reach out to me, John Lindsay-Poland, co-director of the American Friends Service Committee California Healing Justice Program at jlindsay-poland@afsc.org or by phone at 510-282-8983.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

communications.communication:
Hello,



Thank you for contacting the Reclamation FOIA Office.



Please note that FOIA requests submitted via email, are not accepted for processing.



To submit a FOIA request, please use the Department's FOIA Public Access Link at: https://foiaxpresspal.doi.gov/ or the government's central website for FOIA at https://www.foia.gov, unless the requests are for the Office of Inspector General's records.



If you can’t submit your request online, you can file a request by physical mail or fax to  Bureau of Reclamation, Attn: FOIA, P.O. Box 25007 Denver, CO 80225-0007 or (303) 445-6575.



Sincerely,

Erin

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Academic Dishonesty Study (University Of Wisconsin - Madison)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like a spreadsheet containing all the academic dishonesty reports from the beginning of the Fall 2021 semester to the end of the Spring 2025 Semester, organized by university college.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

communications.subject: Anonymous -  - UW-Madison Public Records Request - P2025-229
communications.communication:
RE: Records Request: Request Number: P2025-229 - Submitted On: 7/3/2025 
  
 Dear Requestor, 
  
 This message is regarding: Request Number: P2025-229 
  
 I would like a spreadsheet containing all the academic dishonesty reports from the beginning of the Fall 2021 semester to the end of the Spring 2025 Semester, organized by university college. 
  
 I have begun reviewing records in this request. I received the initial data in excel but have discovered after review has begun that Fried B contains student identifiable information that must be redacted. This data is scattered intermittently in the field and is much more efficiently redacted in adobe. Therefore I have converted the records to adobe for redaction. 
  
 Field A however is the class title, which appears to be more what you are looking for. We do not keep these records by university college as you have requested. They will not be provided that way. 
  
 I have two alternatives for you: 
  
 Alt 1: Get in excel Field A (only) which is the "count" and class abbreviation for each count of academic dishonesty reported to the Dean of Students office. 
  
 Alt 2: Get Fields A and B in adobe so they can be redacted in accordance with the requirements of federal law. We simply do not have the staff capital to redact in excel which takes at least twice as long as redaction in adobe when we currently have 120 other requesters waiting for records. 
  
 Please reply by 8.28.25 with you alternative choice. Obviously Alt 1 will be a quick turnaround after that, Alt will take longer. 
  
 Of you do not reply by August 28th, I will take silence as acceptance of Alt 1 and will reply with that material. You may always make a new request. 
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Julie Laundrie 
 Public Records Custodian 
 Office of Compliance 
 University of Wisconsin-Madison 
  
 University of Wisconsin-Madison 
 500 Lincoln Drive
361 Bascom Hall
Madison, Wisconsin 53706 
 (608) 265-6018

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request #P2025-229
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Thank you for responding to our request. I should have been more specific in the initial request. In the request, the total number of academic dishonesty reports for each of the following years:

2021-22
2022-23
2023-24
2024-25

We do not need any student names, faculty names, department names, or college names, only the total number of dishonesty reports for each year. With that qualifier, I believe this would no longer fall under FERPA protection, since no record is tied to an individual and all records are aggregated to the college level. Thank you in advance for your cooperation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Johann "Jack" Unterweger FBI File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI files pertaining to Johann "Jack" Unterweger (16 August 1950  – 29 June 1994), who was an Austrian serial killer who committed at least twelve murders in Austria, West Germany, Czechoslovakia and the United States. Unterweger was under FBI surveillance circa 1992, when he fled Austria to Miami, where he was arrested on Feb 27, 1992.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Unterweger

Please search first for any prior releases and/or pre-processed files, and release them on a rolling basis before processing any new material generated by this request. 

If no prior releases are available, please kindly conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, however as noted below, please inform me prior to performing any searches incurring fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth J Klein

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Police Foundations PR (Baltimore Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking records as they relate to the department and donations, grants, or other gifts from police nonprofits, including Foundations, Benevolent Funds, Boosters, Activities Leagues, and Associations. Include local and national police nonprofits.

Documents, physical or digital copies of: 
Memorandum of Understanding or any formal agreements with nonprofits.
Polices related to accepting and soliciting donations, monetary and nonmonetary, and grants from any nonprofit.
Policies or requirements by the department on how donations are to be tracked.
Policies regarding any conflict of interest requirements.
Formal grant requests or donation requests filled out by the department or a representative for the department.

Databases that include spreadsheets or whatever form the department tracks such information: 
Donor name
What was donated, monetary and non-monetary value
Date
Release data in .csv form 

For grant and donation data, please only include items and cash valued $500 or more.
Limit searches to 2020 to 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request #MPIA 25-3469
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Maryland Public Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 1, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #MPIA 25-3469.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: MPIA 25-3469
communications.communication:
Good morning Joey Scott,

On August 1, 2025, you submitted a request for public records to the Document Compliance Unit ("DCU") of the Baltimore Police Department ("BPD"), for records as they relate to the department and donations, grants, or other gifts from police nonprofits, including Foundations, Benevolent Funds, Boosters, Activities Leagues, and Associations. Include local and national police nonprofits.

Documents, physical or digital copies of:
Memorandum of Understanding or any formal agreements with nonprofits.
Polices related to accepting and soliciting donations, monetary and nonmonetary, and grants from any nonprofit.
Policies or requirements by the department on how donations are to be tracked.
Policies regarding any conflict of interest requirements.
Formal grant requests or donation requests filled out by the department or a representative for the department.

Databases that include spreadsheets or whatever form the department tracks such information:
Donor name
What was donated, monetary and non-monetary value
Date
Release data in .csv form

Limit searches to 2020 to 2025."

DCU Response:

Attached are the full year reports for fiscal years 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 on the expenditure of grants that the Baltimore Police Department received from the Governor's Office of Crime Control and Prevention.

Nothing in this response is intended to indicate that any records sought from BPD exist or to waive any privileges held by BPD. You have a right under the Public Information Act for the Public Access Ombudsman to mediate any disputes arising out of a MPIA request or a judicial review pursuant to General Provisions Article §§ 4-1B-04, 4-362. Please refer to Tracking Number # MPIA 25-3469 in any subsequent correspondence in this matter.


[cid:image001.png@01DC1CAF.0418F030]<http://www.baltimorecity.gov/>
Baltimore Police

Niki Gills
Investigative Specialist
Office of Police Commissioner/Legal Affairs
601 E. Fayette Street
Baltimore, Maryland  21202
Nichola.gills@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:Nichola.gills@baltimorepolice.org>
